title: NASA delays first crewed flight to the moon in over 50 years
byline: NASA’s Artemis program, which aims to return astronauts to the moon this decade amid a renewed international push for lunar exploration, is facing more delays. The agency said Thursday that a planned mission to land on the moon in 2026 will now take place no earlier than mid-2027.

title: 55 Sri Lankans evacuated from Lebanon
byline: A total of 55 vulnerable Sri Lankan workers have been evacuated from Lebanon, the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beirut said.

title: CEB to submit revised tariff proposal today
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has confirmed that it will submit the revised electricity tariff proposal to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) today.

title: Showers expected in Northern, Eastern Provinces
byline: Thundershowers are likely in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Southern Provinces, as well as in the Nuwara-Eliya and Kandy districts, during the evening or night, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Woman shot dead in Padaviya
byline: A 73-year-old woman was shot dead by two unidentified gunmen who arrived on a motorcycle at Bogahawewa in Padaviya last night.

title: CAA raids drinking water bottling plant
byline: Officers from the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) raided a factory in the Hemmatagama area in Mawanella which had a stock of bottled drinking water.

title: Assembly industry fears ecosystem disruption from CBU import policy
byline: Sri Lanka’s Local Assembler’s Association, has raised concerns over the government’s decision to resume imports of completely built units (CBUs) from February next year.

title: World Bank affirms all support projects in SL will continue uninterrupted
byline: The World Bank Group this week affirmed that all ongoing World Bank-supported projects in Sri Lanka will continue uninterrupted under the country’s new government.

title: Specialists in Matale district asked to take early retirement
byline: The medical fraternity has raised serious concerns over a letter issued by the Regional Director of Health Services in Matale, instructing specialists over the age of 60 to retire by December 31.

title: Crackdown on video sharers is akin to shooting messenger - Additional Magistrate
byline: The Colombo Additional Magistrate questioned how the arrest and request to remand individuals who shared videos related to recent Maaveerar Naal commemorations can be justified without first investigating those who created and uploaded the videos.

title: President assumes duties as Digital Economic Affairs Minister
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today assumed duties as the Minister of Digital Economic Affairs.

title: Fire breaks out at Steuart hotel in Fort
byline: A fire erupted at the Steuart hotel in the Colombo Fort area this evening, according to the fire brigade.

title: Urvil Patel: The journey of a rising cricket star
byline: Urvil Patel, a name that has recently started to echo in the cricketing circles, has an inspiring story of dedication, family support, and unyielding passion for the game.

title: Follow proper mechanism when issuing excise licenses: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake directed officials to follow the proper mechanism when issuing excise licenses, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Imported rice will be cleared within four hours: Customs
byline: Stocks of imported rice will be released from the Colombo Port within four hours of their arrival, provided the necessary taxes are paid,  Additional Director General of Customs, Seevali Arukgoda said.

title: Dujardin handed one-year ban for whipping horse
byline: Three-time Olympic dressage gold medallist Charlotte Dujardin has been banned for one year and fined 10,000 Swiss Francs (£8,886) for ’’excessively’’ whipping a horse.

title: Government assures to release names of politicians who recommended issuing of liquor licenses
byline: The government today assured that the list of the politicians who had recommended the issuing of liquor licenses will be released after investigations.

title: ICC Chair Jay Shah visits Dubai headquarters
byline: Newly elected ICC Chair Jay Shah commenced his tenure with a trip to ICC Headquarters.
